Name: Phishing-Resistant MFA SHALL be required for all users.
New user enrollment period SHALL be set to 1 week.
Allow users to trust the device SHALL be disabled.
If phishing-resistant MFA is not yet tenable, an MFA method from the following list SHALL be used in the interim.
Policies restricting access to GWS based on signals about enterprise devices SHOULD be implemented.
Use of context-aware access for more granular controls, including using Advanced Mode (CEL), MAY be maximized and tailored if necessary.
Login Challenges SHALL be enabled when third party SAML SSO is in use.
Users SHALL be forced to re-authenticate after an established 12-hour GWS login session has expired.
Setting Name (Is): Session management settings - Session length in seconds

Name: User password strength SHALL be enforced.
User password length SHALL be at least 12 characters.
Password policy SHALL be enforced at next sign-in.
Setting Name (Is): Password Management - Enforce password policy at next login

Name: User passwords SHALL NOT be reused.
User passwords SHALL NOT expire.
All highly privileged accounts SHALL leverage Google Account authentication with phishing-resistant MFA and not the agencyâ€™s authoritative on-premises or federated identity system.
A minimum of two and maximum of four separate and distinct Super Admin users SHALL be configured.
Account conflict management SHALL be configured to replace conflicting unmanaged accounts with managed ones.
Last Successful Test: Not Alertable due to no log event being produced

Name: Account self-recovery for Super Admins SHALL be disabled, forcing Super Admin users who have lost their login credentials to contact another Super Admin to recover their account.
Highly privileged accounts SHALL be enrolled in the GWS Advanced Protection Program.
Setting Name (Is): Advanced Protection Program Settings - Enable user enrollment

Name: All sensitive user accounts SHOULD be enrolled into the GWS Advanced Protection Program. This control enforces more secure protection of sensitive user accounts from targeted attacks. Sensitive user accounts include political appointees and other Senior Executive Service (SES) officials whose account compromise would pose a level of risk prohibitive to agency mission fulfillment.
Setting Name (Is): Advanced Protection Program Settings - Enable user enrollment

Name: Agencies SHALL use GWS application access control policies to restrict access to all GWS services by third party apps.
Agencies SHALL NOT allow users to consent to access to low-risk scopes.
Agencies SHALL NOT trust unconfigured internal apps.
Event (Is):
Allow Google Sign-in only third party API access
OR
        All third party API access unblocked

Name: Agencies SHALL NOT allow users to access unconfigured third-party apps.
Event (Is): All third party API access unblocked

Name: Agencies SHALL NOT allow users to access unconfigured third-party apps.
Event (Is): Allow Google Sign-in only third party API access

Name: Only approved Google Workspace Marketplace applications SHOULD be allowed for installation.
Only approved Google Workspace Marketplace applications SHALL be allowed for installation.
Access to Google Workspace applications by less secure apps that do not meet security standards for authentication SHALL be prevented.
Event (Is): Less Secure Apps Access Setting Changed

Name: Google Takeout services SHALL be disabled for users.

Required system-defined alerting rules, as listed in the Policy section, SHALL be active, with alerts enabled when available. Any system-defined rules not are considered optional but ought to be reviewed for consideration.
The following critical logs SHALL be sent at a minimum.
Setting Name (Is): Data Sharing Settings between GCP and Google Workspace "Sharing Options"

Name: The data storage region SHALL be set to be the United States for all users in the agency's GWS environment.
The supplemental data storage region SHALL NOT be set to 'Russian Federation'.
